title: Task 1: Describe visual or contextual elements of a work of art, including: form, style, materials, content, function, context, siting/physical context, subject matter, or reception of a work of art.
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. Each point is earned independently.
descriptions: Response does NOT accurately describe visual characteristics of the Doryphoros (Spear Bearer).
Response accurately describes ONE visual characteristic of the Doryphoros (Spear Bearer).
Response accurately describes TWO visual characteristics of the Doryphoros (Spear Bearer).

title: Task 2: Using specific evidence, explains how a specific work of art (or group of related works) demonstrates continuity within an artistic tradition, style, or practice OR using specific evidence, explains how a specific work of art (or group of related works) demonstrates change within an artistic tradition, style, or practice.
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. Each point is earned independently.
descriptions: Response does NOT accurately use specific visual evidence to explain how the work demonstrates continuity with earlier Greek artistic traditions.
Response accurately uses ONE example of specific visual evidence to explain how the work demonstrates continuity with earlier Greek artistic traditions.

title: Task 3: Using specific evidence, explains how a specific work of art (or group of related works) demonstrates continuity within an artistic tradition, style, or practice OR using specific evidence, explains how a specific work of art (or group of related works) demonstrates change within an artistic tradition, style, or practice.
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. Each point is earned independently.
descriptions: Response does NOT accurately use specific visual evidence to explain how the work demonstrates change from earlier Greek artistic traditions.
Response accurately uses ONE example of specific visual evidence to explain how the work demonstrates change from earlier Greek artistic traditions.

title: Task 4: Explain the meaning or significance of continuity and/or change between works of art within a related artistic tradition, style and/or practice.
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. Each point is earned independently.
descriptions: Response does NOT accurately use specific visual or contextual evidence to explain why this sculpture is considered to be influential on later artistic periods.
Response accurately uses specific visual or contextual evidence to explain why this sculpture is considered to be influential on later artistic periods.
